attributes.action: Declare EU referendum void as 16 & 17 year olds were denied the vote
attributes.background: The EU referendum is a significant constitutional event.  It will affect the rights and opportunities of all UK citizens for many years to come. The 16 & 17 year old should have been given a vote. The precedent for this already having been established for the recent Scottish Independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The size of the youth vote is large enough to have had a material effect on the outcome of the election

attributes.action: Make Government & Politics an optional GCSE subject
attributes.background: Government & Politics is currently not an existing GCSE qualification, with increased voter apathy in particular amongst young people, giving them the tools to engage in the political process, should they wish, from an earlier age than currently exists may increase political participation.
attributes.additional_details: In the EU Referendum (2016) voter turnout amongst 18-24 year olds was 36% (@SkyData), however the turnout for the referendum as a whole was 72% showing voter apathy to be particular prevalent amongst the young.

attributes.action: Post-Brexit breakup reunion with Scotland to re-join EU
attributes.background: Should the UK break up after leaveing the EU, following the EU Referendum result, we the undersigned call upon HM Government to consider uniting with an independent Scotland, thus allowing a re-entry into the EU under a Scottish alliance.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of hemp oil for medical purpose within the UK.
attributes.background: Scientific facts prove the benifit of this oil..
attributes.additional_details: Rick Simpson  cancer uk. Many other scientific studies.

attributes.action: Allow the Black Country to seperate from the union, and ignore laws of London.
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum, it has been suggested that the city of London break away from the Union. 
To save any hassle, we suggest that the Black Country break away from the rule of London, and set up our own system of government and law, as London wants nothing to do with the nation.

attributes.action: False statements and misrepresentation by politicians to be electoral fraud
attributes.background:
It is currently only counts as electoral fraud if a party makes a false statement about the character of a candidate.
Nobody is held to account for misrepresenting policies and outcomes in elections which is much more dangerous, leading people to vote based on false information.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of this include:
The Vote Leave campaign claiming to spend £350 million a week on the NHS which was quickly denied the morning after the referendum.
Liberal Democrats wanting to rid students of tuition fees, but in a coalition government put fees up to £9000 a year.

attributes.action: EU nationals contributing to UK economy for at least 15 years to get citizenship
attributes.background: Following the referendum EU nationals who have made their lives in the UK,  who contribute to society by working and paying taxes are worried about their future. No one knows what the negotiations will bring. The proposal is for EU nationals in the UK for at least 15 years to gain Citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Being a contributing factor to the economy of the UK for this average length of time proves dedication to be part of the UK society and culture. EU nationals who have built their lives in the UK, are at risk of facing visa/work restrictions. Citizenship or indefinite right to remain for the contributors.

attributes.action: Disallow MPs from of having secondary employment with a conflict of interest
attributes.background: I believe an mp should not be allowed a say in matter of interest, where they have role in private companies that have a vested interest in the sector. For example, someone with a role in private medical care industry, should have no say in the NHS. I believe this to be unethical.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on rejoining the EU every tenth year, starting June 2026.
attributes.background:
Young people voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU (about 75% of those aged 18-24).

To give them hope, we're asking that in June 2026, and in every tenth June afterwards so long as Britain is outside the EU, a referendum be held on the question "Should Britain now apply to rejoin the EU?".

attributes.action: Set up a public inquiry to examine the regulation of political campaigns.
attributes.background:
“...political campaign material in the UK is not regulated...it is a matter for voters to decide...whether they consider it accurate or not.” - Electoral Commission

We, the undersigned, ask for a wide-ranging public inquiry, similar to the Leveson inquiry, to be set up to consider the following:
attributes.additional_details:
1) Is there sufficient independent regulation in place to ensure that political campaigns and individuals act in line with the Nolan principles*? 
2) Should a regulator be given the authority to regulate political advertising?
3) Should the media be required to include political balance in news articles? 

*https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-7-principles-of-public-life/the-7-principles-of-public-life--2

attributes.action: Put more funding towards schools and other public services.
attributes.background: Public services such as schools and the NHS are not very well funded. After leaving the EU, we will be apparently saving £350 million a week. Some of this money should go to public services.

attributes.action: Cameron should call a state of emergency. The country is divided and in turmoil!
attributes.background: The leave vote was not decisive enough to justify changing all our lives

attributes.action: No more cuts for working age people. Remove ringfencing of pensioner benefits
attributes.background: Since the financial crisis and recession it's young and working age people who have born the brunt of budget cutbacks. Real wages have fallen 7% for working families and 16% for 18-24 year olds. Pensioners have seen a 4% increase in the incomes which is neither fair or sustainable going forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst efforts to raise living standards in the elderly population is commendable, the disparity is now too great and ringfencing of pensioner benefits should be removed. This has become even more pressing in light out the EU referendum where the over 65 group voted strongly in favour of leaving the EU. Any negative economic effects of this decision should be shared across all who voted for it.

Figures quoted from Machin 2015

attributes.action: Make smoking a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is the biggest cause of premature deaths in the UK. Cigarette smoke contains around 4,000 chemicals, among which are over 50 known carcinogens. It is clear smoking needs to be stopped. By making smoking illegal it provides smokers with an incentive; quit or face charges.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking kills around 100,000 per year. Some of the cancers caused by smoking include lung, mouth, larynx, oesophagus and leukaemia to name just a few. Other problems can include heart disease, dementia, pulmonary fibrosis and gum disease. Smoking needs to be stopped right now. And if making it illegal is the only way, so be it. Sign now and create a healthier nation for the sake of a family member you might know who smokes. If smoking is made illegal, it could save the life of someone you know.

attributes.action: Represent remain voters equally within new government leadership framework
attributes.background: 48% of the voting public wanted to remain in the EU, it is unrepresentative and undemocratic that the leaders of our government should stand for a UK polar opposite to what we stand for. Significant Remain Tory representatives should have key roles in the upcoming changes within cabinet.
attributes.additional_details: Young members of voting demographic feel disenfranchised and as though they have unfairly lost out on something they believed in. 48% of the public who voted wish to remain in the EU and do not want a far right, nationalist government. In order for this proportion of the population to feel represented and valued as voters and citizens, those wishing to remain need to be represented equally by senior remain politicians in the new government framework after Cameron's formal resignation.

attributes.action: Hold a second, and if necessary, third EU Referendum for a best-of-three vote.
attributes.background:
With the EU Referendum results having been announced, there is a clear divide between the country, a result bordering a tie with less than a two-percent margin. 
Those undersigned believe that a second vote should be held, to confirm the wishes of the British people, with a third vote if necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a big decision for our country. The results of the first EU referendum to decide whether or not we should remain within the European Union have already affected our nation in significant ways, most notable of which being the value of the pound, and that decision should not be left for a singular vote.

If a second vote were to happen, and the results declared the same, then no more referendums would be necessary and such a decision taken forward.

attributes.action: Make  winning majority vote in referendum (such as EU vote) need majority of 10%
attributes.background: Today's EU referendum results show that the country is very much in a 50/50 split with only approximately 4%  difference.  Since referendum are there for major countrywide decisions (rather than a 5 year government) a more decisive majority is needed.

attributes.action: Stop Crossrail 2 from destroying Iconic buildings in Wimbledon town.
attributes.background: This will effect so many peoples lives during the construction phase over the next 8-10 years, as buildings, homes and companies are demolished leaving business owners scrambling for new jobs. Wimbledon would also be clogged up with traffic jams. This,ultimately will effect the future of Wimbledon.
attributes.additional_details:
At first I was excited about Crossrail 2, until the government revealed the building being demolished. 

The following are the names of companies/buildings that will be demolished:
Center Court
Waitrose
WHsmith
Tesco
M&S
H&M
Next
Waterstones
Maplins
JD Sports
HMV
O2
Gregs
Lush
Currys PC World
Entertainer
Lakeland
Debanhams
Wimbledon Bridge House
Vodaphone 
Subway
Burger King
British Heart Foundation
Jacks
The Terrace 
Coral1,2 
Jennings Bet
Flight Centre
Doddle
Everyday church
Krystals

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Stop government funding to FA unless it withdraws from FIFA
attributes.background: Folowing on-going coruption allegations and FIFA imposing fines on UK teams for wearing poppies the home nation Football Associations should receive no funding, recognition  or support of any kind from the UK government until they withdraw from FIFA and set up an alternative world cup tournament

attributes.action: Reduce income tax paid on bonus payments
attributes.background:
We work hard to achieve a bonus at work, however the tax that we are paying on bonuses is nearly a third including NI contributions.

Bonuses are achieved by companies and/or individuals doing well in their career and they deserve to earn their full reward for this.

attributes.action: Protect Local Authority centrally held funding for Early Years Intervention
attributes.background:
Government changes to Early Years centrally held funding are threatening the existence of the outstanding Pen Green Centre, a pioneer in early years integration. 
NCC funds the majority of the centre's work via the centrally held fund and changes will inadvertently see a savage reduction in budget.
attributes.additional_details:
We know DfE did not intend to threaten the country’s largest and most innovative nursery school.
Whilst we support the principle of funds being redirected to the front line we urgently request the government ring-fence funds for Pen Green and other integrated nursery schools before February 2017. 

Furthermore we urge the government to enact a caveat to the future funding arrangements whereby integrated nursery schools are protected financially to continue their outstanding work from hereon in.

attributes.action: Make a law against Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases.
attributes.background: Daily Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases are taking place. More animals are dying because of this. Animals can mistake litter for its' food when it eats this litter, it clogs up its guts - eventually killing it. With this, more species of animals are dying. Plus, it pollutes our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases usually take place, because of the start of a new life, or the end of a life. Instead of polluting our wildlife and environment, plant a tree. It is much cheaper, and will last a lot longer! A little plaque can be placed in front of it, to dedicate the memory of somebody, or a time/event. It is a lot cheaper, efficient and friendly (both socially and environmentally).

attributes.action: Make car insurance more affordable for all persons who have never made a claim.
attributes.background: I never knew some years ago that my no claims bonus would expire after two years, as a result of this obtaining affordable car insurance is now near impossible! I have purchased a used car for £500 and my insurance quotes are well over £1000 with a deposit equivalent to my households weekly income!
attributes.additional_details: I think that all persons should have a "claims background record" that would be similar to credit history wear all past claims and no claims are noted. I have been driving for 15 years and have never made a claim in my life! How is it fair that I or anybody else should be penalised for not having any proof of no claims. I have had to take out temporary cover costing me £75 for 7 days until I figure out what I can do! If I took the insurance on offer simply paying the deposit would mean my children and myself would starve, no bills would get paid and we would also be without gas and electric, and that is the reality of the situation and it simply needs to change.

attributes.action: Government should ban competency based interviews.
attributes.background:
The Government should ban competence based interviews as they ignore education, knowledge, skills and past working experience of good candidates and can also be used to discriminate against candidates without detection.

Bring back the old interview system that helped make Britain Great.
attributes.additional_details:
A fair system of scoring candidates should be:
1.	Experience –with proof (25%)
2.	Education- with proof (25%)
3.	Knowledge/ Experience – with proof (25%)
4.	Competencies – through interview (25%)

attributes.action: Allow railway season ticket holders to vote on operator's franchise renewal.
attributes.background: Commuters usually have no choice about using the train. They cannot strike or otherwise inconvenience the operator in order to force improvements. They have no influence and are therefore totally ignored by the operators. Only if we can directly affect the operators will they take any notice of us.
attributes.additional_details:
If enough season ticket holders vote against renewal then the existing franchise holder is banned from being considered at any price.  
The vote would be open only to those holding monthly or longer season tickets for at least 3 months of the year. 
A majority of at least 60% (to be agreed) would be needed to remove the existing operator from consideration.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Ban homework in the UK
attributes.background: The children do plenty of work in school
attributes.additional_details: How are they supposed to eat, hang out with friends, do school clubs, bathe and get 8 hours of sleep when they have so much homework?

attributes.action: Review how families are means tested for benefits.
attributes.background:
Why is it only those who do not work or those on low income that get support from the government?

What about those hard working families with a household salary that looks great on paper, who pay thousands in taxes a year, that struggle to afford everyday living costs?
attributes.additional_details:
I personally think there needs to be a complete over-hall in how people are means tested in order to receive benefits and what financial help is made available to all families that struggle regardless of their household income.

My self and my partner on paper have a pretty good household income. Just over £50k a year. However, when you take away costs such as rent/mortgage, utility bills, childcare, travel, food, and everyday living we are left with not much to spare.

attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: Give photo ID cards to Veterans
attributes.background: I  joined my regular Battalion The Royal Welch Fusiliers. During my time in The RWF I was lucky enough to visit such places as Germany, Cyprus, Central America (Belize) and of course visited Northern Ireland four times ( 1973, 1974, 1075 & 1976)

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence to not report child abuse to the police.
attributes.background: many hundreds of children have suffered and continue to suffer because of institutional doubt.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is of course supported by the often late action of hundreds of whistle-blowers who should have reported their feelings much earlier than they did. This petition would remove both doubt and onus by making a legally required course of action perfectly clear to all concerned.

attributes.action: Headteachers should be aware of what disability a child has in mainstream school
attributes.background: Due to a recent observation through out mainstream schools Head teachers should have the duty of care to know and be aware of the disabilities of special needs chilldren.

attributes.action: Require that all single use drinks cups are 100% biodegradable.
attributes.background: Currently only around 1 in every 400 single use drinks cups, mainly used for takeaway coffee are recycled.  Many such cups end up littering our pavements, parks, beaches and rivers. It is time that all such cups should be 100% biodegradable to minimise their impact on the environment.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: Close Pentonville Prison
attributes.background: This prison is failing both inmates and the general public, and needs to be closed immediately.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-prisoners-escape-pentonville-prison-north-london-ministry-justice-a7402701.html

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Offer support mentally for citizens dealing with life changing disabilities
attributes.background: For example, many people in the UK suffer with a life limiting/ changing disability. Help as such as how to operate a wheelchair, how to tune cochlear implants etc is provided by the nhs. No help mentally is provided to help people adjust to their new lives.
attributes.additional_details: I know many people including myself who have suffered from a life changing disability. Obviously these disabilites have a major effect on our life and how we see it. Out of everyone i know, not one fraction of us was offered someone to talk to.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: The mandatory installation of an automatic braking system in all lorries
attributes.background: Due to the recent tragic accidental killing of a family of four people by a lorry with a distracted driver, I petition that all lorries be fitted with an mandatory automatic braking system that would come into force if the driver were incapacitated or distracted.

attributes.action: To allow our Daughter in Law from China to come to UK to meet us
attributes.background:
Our son has been married for four and half years and had to sell up here in the uk to be with his wife as she had two applications turned down once because they did not believe they were married second that she would not return to China.
We are now in our late 80s and would like to meet her soon

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.
